thread.title: Trekking Iran's Lut desert: a wild, remote adventure – in pictures
thread.title_full: Trekking Iran's Lut desert: a wild, remote adventure – in pictures

author: The Guardian
title: Trekking Iran's Lut desert: a wild, remote adventure – in pictures
text:
Trekking Iran's Lut desert: a wild, remote adventure – in pictures Trekking Iran's Lut desert: a wild, remote adventure – in pictures View more sharing options Share on Messenger Close 
Iran’s Dasht-e Lut with its giant dunes, salt plains and kaluts provides an epic journey of breathtaking beauty and wilderness, as seen in these images from a 15-day trek with Secret Compass   10.56 GMT Last modified on   11.06 GMT Iran’s Lut desert is an otherworldly place of shifting sands and wind-blasted rock formations. It is the backdrop for an epic trek offered by Secret Compass. Here the group cross the Mega-Dunes on the eastern flank of the Dasht-e-Lut.• All photographs: Jerome Poulin, Secret Compass The trekking group assembles to the western edge of the Mega-Dunes. Support vehicles race across the flat desert plain heading towards the Eye of the Lut. Pillars of fossilised escarpments in the Eye of the Lut. Star Dune fields west of the Eye of the Lut. Remnants of fossilised dune fields west of the Star Dunes. Descending towards the Kalut valleys of the western Dasht-e-Lut. Plain leading to the broken escarpments of the Kaluts. Search for a passageway through the Kalut field. The Kalut fields nearing the western edge of the Dasht-e-Lut. Secret Compass’s next Lut Desert expedition is November 4-18 and costs £3,499 including all food, accommodation (tented) and expedition leader. Topics
